help.helpText: After finding or listing a set of drug programmes, use the radio buttons below to select the drug programme that you wish to configure using the radio-button selector.
The drug programme identifier
The total number of studies within the drug programme that are know to the ACUITY system either via a link to the IMPACT data system, or that have been manually added through the ACUITY system.
The number of studies that have been enabled for further configuration (e.g. data mapping) in ACUITY
Whether the drug programme itself has been previously set up within the ACUITY system.
Provides a link to the summary of the set up for and drug programmes that have been ACUITY-enabled.
The drug programme identifier
This is the name that will be visible in ACUITY and VA Security. Spotfire files will be named using the Drug Programme ID.
Whether the drug programme itself has previously been set up within the ACUITY system.
The total number of studies within the drug programme that are known to the ACUITY system either via link to the IMPACT data system, or have been enabled for further configuration.
The number of studies that have been enabled for further configuration (e.g. data mapping) in ACUITY

The name of the individual who will have the primary responsibility for administering ACUITY for this drug project. Current guidance indicates this should be the Medical Science Director. This field is used to help the ACUITY team manage ACUITY for drug programmes.

The name of the individual who will have the responsibility of authorising access for other users to the ACUITY visualisations for this drug programme. Current guidance indicates that this should be the Medical Science Director. This field is used by the ACUITY team to set up processes for authorisation to see study data.
A programme-level view displaying high-level study counts, which are important to ascertain current progress for a particular drug.

Select the type of grouping that you wish to create. The options are adverse event groupings, where different preferred terms can be grouped, or lab measurement groupings whereby different types of lab measurement can be grouped. The idea is that this allows a customisable way to group together sets of patient data that are of particular interest to your drug programme.

Each grouping must have a unique name, but it is up to you what name you use. We recommend you use a name that is fairly explanatory so that your group is identifiable at other stages in the ACUITY configuration.

The default group value is the values for the group name that will be assigned to any adverse event (for adverse event groupings) or lab measurement (for lab measurement groups) that are not explicitly assigned to a group in the data provided by the user. For clarity, we recommend you use a value such as "not assigned to a group".

Here you must either provide the location of the data file which holds (or will hold) the grouping information, or select to perform manual entry. If you are uploading a file, the format of that file must be as two columns, where the first column holds the name of the groups and the seconds column holds the terms being grouped. The file should be comma-separated (.csv) text file.
Check the box if the file you wish to upload has a header row. Header rows will not be used in these groupings.

Check the box if the grouping you are creating is appropriate to be used in ACUITY visualisations. Leaving the box unchecked will mean that although your grouping configuration will be stored, the groupin will not be available for use in ACUITY visualisations.
Grouping names uniquely identify each user-defined data grouping to be identifiable at other stages in the ACUITY configuration.
The grouping type refers to what sort of variable is being grouped. Adverse event groupings group different MedDRA preferred terms and lab measurement groupings group sets of lab measurements types
The data source refers to the source of grouping data. This may be a file, or the data may have been entered manually through this interface.
ACUITY enabled being checked means that the groupings can be used in ACUITY visualisations. Go to "Edit Settings" to change the value of this checkbox.
Shows the name of the user who last edited this grouping.
Shows the date when this grouping was last edited.

In this column you can view and edit the group names. Group names are user-defined, but we recommend that these names capture the rationale behind the group. Note that group names are case-sensitive. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.

In this column, you can view and edit the adverse events preferred terms, or lab measurement preferred names being grouped. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.

In this column you can view and edit the group names. Group names are user-defined, but we recommend that these names capture the rationale behind the group. Note that group names are case-sensitive. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.
In this column, you can view and edit labcode for each Lab grouping. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.
In this column, you can view and edit the description for labcode.

Here we list the drug programmes that have been configured to use ACUITY. You may add a new drug programme, edit an existing drug programme, or remove an existing drug programme configuration using the buttons below. Selecting a drug programme from a list will allow you to view the clinical study data sets and ACUITY visualisation modules that have been configured for the programme.

Here we list the clinical study data sets that have been configured to use ACUITY for the drug programme selected, above. You may add a new study configuration, edit an existing study configuration, or remove an existing study configuration using the buttons below.

Here we list the visualisation modules that have been configured for the drug programme selected. You may add a new visualisation module, edit an existing visualisation module, or remove an existing visualisation module using the buttons below.
The dataset identifier
The name of the clinical study
The clinical study phase

The setup status of the study in ACUITY.
"Not added to ACUITY" indicates that the study is not ready to be configured in ACUITY as the parent drug programme has not been set up to allow this study to be configured. To remedy this you can reconfigure the drug programme.
"Ready to map" indicates that the drug programme has been set up to allow this study to be configured, but no study configuration has yet been recorded.
"Mapping in progress" indicates that the study configuration is underway, but incomplete.
"Previously mapped" indicates that the mapping is sufficiently complete and enabled such that ACUITY can use the study data in visualisations.
The drug programme identifier. This field is important for the organisation of date in ACUITY
The dataset identifier. This field is important for the organisation of data in ACUITY
The name of the dataset. This field is for user reference only and does not affect the data processing in ACUITY.
The clinical study identifier. This field is important for the organisation of data in ACUITY
The name of the clinical study. This field is for user reference only and does not affect the data processing in ACUITY.
The clinical study phase. This field is for user reference only and does not affect the data processing in ACUITY.
The type of study, such as dose-finding. This field is for user reference only and does not affect the data processing in ACUITY.
The organisational process through which the study is being made, e.g., run by internal AZ R&D. This field is for user reference only and does not affect the data processing in ACUITY.

For prospective studies this should be an estimate of the date when the first subject will be dosing. For studies that have already begun, this should approximate the actual date for first subject dosing. This date can be modified as more is known about the study organisation. This date will be used to help the ACUITY team establish when data updates are likely to being.

This should be an estimate for when the primary database lock will occur. This date can be modified according to the progression of the study. This date will be used to help the ACUITY team establish when the ACUITY system should be shut down for the study

The folder location where the source files are stored. This is usually the CAVE location for this study‘s SAS files. This field allows the user to designate the location for the automatic mapping functions to search for the correct files.

This field refers to whether the study has a blinding aspect. This field is critically important for correct use of data in ACUITY. If you are unsure of the correct value, or if this status has not yet been decided, select "Blinded" as this will ensure that the integrity of the study is not compromised.

This field refers to whether the study subjects are randomised between study arms. This field is critically important for the correct use of data in ACUITY. If you are unsure of the correct value, or if this status has not yet been decided, then select "Randomised" as this will ensure that the integrity of the study is not compromised.

This field refers to whether the study will deliver or support a licensing submission. This field is critically important for the correct use of data in ACUITY. If you are unsure of the correct value, or if this status has not yet been decided, then select "Regulatory" as this will ensure that the integrity of the study is not compromised.
Only applicable if including genomic data (for the Genomic Profile visualisation) and the link out to cBio is required. Information required by cBioPortal.
Enabling will allow relevant data to be sent to Azure Machine Learning Studio. It will be possible to view outcomes in the Machine Insights QT Interval plot.
Select the type of data that is being mapped into ACUITY from the drop-down list.

Here you must either provide the location of the data file which holds (or will hold) the grouping information. The files can either be SAS (sas7bdat) or a comma-separated (.csv) text file. If the file location is yet to be established, but you want to start mapping configuration, choose the upper option.

Check the box if the data mapped is appropriate and correctly configured to be used in ACUITY visualisations. Leaving the box unchecked will mean that although your configuration will be stored, the data will not be available for use in ACUITY visualisations.
Displays the type of data that is being mapped into ACUITY
Displays the location of the source data, if known.
ACUITY enabled being checked means that the data can be used in ACUITY visualisations. Go to "Edit Settings" to change the value of this checkbox.
Shows the name of the user who last edited this grouping.
Shows the date when this grouping was last edited.
The name of the ACUITY data field.
The name of the column in the source data that maps to the ACUITY data field. You may add more than one column, to do this put multiple column names separated by commas.

Some data, particularly data in SAS files, is coded into integers. In order for ACUITY to extract some meaningful values, information about how to change codes to meaningful values may be required. To do this, you must first configure the mapping for a value decoding file. The value entered into this column must be equivalent to a value that will appear in the "code group name" field of that value decoding file.
A default value that will be assigned to the ACUITY field in the case where no equivalent column exists in the source data, or where the value in the source data is blank.

These aggregation functions allow the ACUITY system to make sense of some of the more complicated data mapping requirements for ACUITY. For most mapped data, no aggregation is required. However, for date values the ACUITY system must be told whether it is the day, or month, that appear first in the date representation. In addition, the user can make ACUITY system take the maximum value from a set of numerical columns. This is particularly useful when a maximum CTC grade must be taken from a set of different CTC values.
This column indicates whether the field in question is mandatory, or not. For a data table mapping to be considered complete, all mandatory fields must be mapped, whereas other fields are optional.

The Data Checklist provides a summary of the mapping progress for the study date. Information types that are not completely mapped (where not all mandatory fields are mapped to a source data file column) are shown with a red question mark and information types that are completely mapped to a minimum acceptable level are shown with a green tick mark. Note that a green tick mark does not necessarily indicate that your choice of mapping is accurate! In addition, for a study to be considered to be ready for use in one or more ACUITY visualisation modules, all of the information types listed as "Mandatory patient information" must be completely mapped.
Grouping names uniquely identify each user-defined subject grouping and allow the grouping
The data source refers to the source of grouping data. This may be a file, or the data may have been entered manually through this interface.
ACUITY enabled being checked means that the data can be used in ACUITY visualisations. Go to "Edit Settings" to change the value of this checkbox.
Shows the name of the user who last edited this grouping.
Shows the date when this grouping was last edited.

In this column you can view and edit the group names. Group names are user-defined, but we recommend that these names capture the rationale behind the group. Note that group names are case-sensitive. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.

In this column you can view and edit the adverse events preferred terms, or lab measurement preferred names being grouped. You can click in the table cells to make edits to the group names, then click on Save to store your changes.
The dataset summary provides an overview of the clinical study dataset setup. you should check this is correct before finishing the setup
Here we show a summary of the data mappings for the clinical study
Here we show a summary of the alternative subject groupings for the clinical study.

For this study to be used in ACUITY, we must be sure that all of the set up is appropriate. In particular, the blinding, randomisation and regulatory statuses of the set up are correct and that no inappropriate (e.g. unblinding) subject groups have been created. To confirm the setup is correct you must indicate this in the disclaimer.
Here we record the history of study set up confirmation so that it is clear who has taken responsibility for confirmation and when confirmation was granted.
Select the drug programme for which you wish to create a set of ACUITY visualisations. Note that only drug programmes that have been configured for ACUITY are displayed.
Select the datasets for which you wish to create a set of ACUITY visualisations. Note only clinical studies that have been configured for ACUITY are displayed. You must select at least one study.

Select the adverse event groupings you wish to include in your ACUITY visualisations. Selecting a grouping is not essential for ACUITY set up. In order to set up a new adverse event grouping you should visit the drug programme setup.

Select the lab measurement groupings you wish to include in your ACUITY visualisations. Selecting a grouping is not essential for ACUITY set up. In order to set up a new adverse event grouping you should visit the drug programme setup.

ACUITY modules are sets of visualisations tailored to explore a particular aspect of the clinical studies. The current choices available are ACUITY Safety (designed to allow exploration of safety-related signals in the data) and ACUITY Tolerability (designed to allow exploration of the drug tolerability). Further modules may be added over time. You will only be allowed to choose modules that are appropriate based on the types of studies you have selected.

Each set of ACUITY visualisations must be given a unique name, this will be used as the analysis file name. The first part of the name is standard and has been completed for you. Try to use short, but meaningful names. For example, "ACUITY_Safety_STDY4321_study1"

Select the alternative subject groupings you wish to include in your ACUITY visualisations. Selecting a grouping is not essential for ACUITY set up. In order to set up a new adverse event grouping you should visit the drug programme setup.
Select the biomarker groupings you wish to include in your ACUITY Oncology visualisations.
ACUITY views are visualisations tailored to explore a particular aspect of the clinical study. Here you may select any views that are appropriate for the type of studies within the ACUITY module.

Warnings indicate the reasons why certain ACUITY views are not available. This may be due to a lack of source data, in which case you may be able to revisit the clinical study setup and provide further mappings, or because the type of view is not appropriate for the type of study (based on the randomisation, blinding and regulatory statuses of the studies).
This summary provides an overview of the ACUITY module that will be set up. Before finishing the setup, you should check whether this information is correct.

For theseACUITY visualisations to be created, you should ensure that the configuration is appropriate. In particular, you should consider that after creation, all authorised users will have access to this visualisation through ACUITY. You can confirm the configuration is correct and continue to create this ACUITY instance by confirmation in the disclaimer, then pressing the Finish button.

1. ‘Somatic status‘ should equal one of the following values: • ‘known‘ • ‘likely‘ • ‘unknown‘ 2. ‘known‘ or ‘likely‘ values will be shown in the Genomic Profile 3. ‘unknown‘ values will not be shown in the Genomic Profile

1. ‘Variant-type‘ should equal one of the following values: • ‘short-variant‘ • ‘copy number alteration‘ • ‘rearrangement‘ 2. When the value is: • ‘short-variant‘ the mutation type field is taken from ‘Mutation type‘ in the data structure • ‘copy number alteration‘ the mutation type field is taken from ‘Copy number alteration type‘ in the data structure • ‘rearrangement‘ the mutation type field is taken from ‘Rearrangement description‘ in the data structure

For a field to appear as NULL in the plot the cell must be empty. If the dataset has e.g. a ‘-‘ to denote NULL then use the decoding function along with an entry in the ‘cntlin‘ file. The Mutation type field in the data structure is used for mutation type when variant type = ‘short variant‘.

For a field to appear as NULL in the plot the cell must be empty. If the dataset has e.g. a ‘-‘ to denote NULL then use the decoding function along with an entry in the ‘cntlin‘ file. The Copy number alteration type (CNA_TYPE) field in the data structure is used for mutation when variant type = ‘copy number alteration‘.

For a field to appear as NULL in the plot the cell must be empty. If the dataset has e.g. a ‘-‘ to denote NULL then use the decoding function along with an entry in the ‘cntlin‘ file. The Rearrangement description (REARR_DESCRIPTION) field in the data structure is used for mutation when variant type = rearrangement.
A string value describing the type of change being made to the dosing schedule
A String value that can hold further description of the serious adverse event
The date on which the adverse event ended
The date on which the adverse event began
The time of day at which the adverse event ended
The time of day at which the adverse event began
A string value describing the type of adverse event
A string value denoting whether any new lesions have been identified since the baseline measurement
A string value denoting whether or not any non-target lesions were present at the time of the non-target lesion assessment
A string value denoting whether ir not any target lesion was found to be present at the time of target lesion assessment
The date on which the vital measurements were performed
A string value denoting the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical unique identifier for the medication
A string value denoting the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical identifier for the medication full name
A unique integer value for the study centre
A string that acts as a group name used to group together distinct sets of codes and their corresponding decoded values
An integer value ‘code‘ that that can be decoded into a meaningful value.
A string value denoting whether or not the serious adverse event caused a congenital abnormality or birth defect

help.pageElement: Date AE Met Criteria for Serious AE
help.helpText: The date on which the serious adverse event met the Serious criteria

help.pageElement: Date Investigator Aware of Serious AE
help.helpText: The date on which investigator became aware of the Serious adverse event
The date of birth of the subject
The date on which the ECG was performed
The date on which the subject was hospitalised due to the serious adverse event
The date on which the subject died
The date on which the subject was discharged from hospital
The date on which the study drug was discontinued
A value that provides the subject decision specification
A value that provides the other subject decision specification
The date on which the measurement was made
A string that is the meaningful (decoded) that can be translated from a coded value
A real number value giving the diastolic blood pressure
An integer value denoting the frequency with which the medication is administered to the subject
A string value that describes the dosing frequency, e.g., "BID" for twice -daily. This field will be used in precedence over the dosing frequency per interval and interval unit fields.
An integer value denoting the frequency with which the study drug is administered to the subject
A string value denoting the unit in which the dosing frequency is measured
A string value denoting the unit in which the medication frequency is measured
A real number value giving the dose of medication given to the subject per administration
A string value denoting the unit in which the dose amount is measured
The date on which the medication regimen ended

help.pageElement: End date/time of the dose schedule
help.helpText: The date on which the dosing schedule ended

help.pageElement: Free text where the reason is specified.
help.helpText: A string value providing the further reasons for which the study drug was discontinued
A real number giving the height of the subject
The date on which the LVEF imaging was performed

help.pageElement: Investigator Opinion Agrees with RECIST Response (yes/no)
help.helpText: A string value denoting whether or not the investigator opinion of response agrees with the RECIST response
A string value giving the investigator opinion of response
A real number value denoting the LVEF
A real number value that gives the lower reference range value for the laboratory test result for the subject
A string identifier denoting what sort of laboratory measurement was made
A string value denoting the units in which the laboratory value is measured
A real number value that gives the value for the laboratory test result
A string value denoting whether or not the adverse event was life threatening
A real number value denoting the longest diameter of the target lesion
A string value denoting the method by which the LVEF was measured
A string value that describes any alternative method used to measure the LVEF

help.pageElement: Main Reason for Action Taken, Study Drug
help.helpText: A string value describing the main reason for change being made to the dosing schedule

help.pageElement: Main reason for Investigational Product Discontinuation
help.helpText: A string value providing the main reason for which the study drug was discontinued
A MedDRA Higher-Level Term Name string assigned to the adverse event
A MedDRA Low-Level Term Name string assigned to the adverse event
A MedDRA Preferred Term Name string assigned to the adverse event
A MedDRA System Organ class abbreviation or name string assigned to the adverse event
The MedDRA version used to code the adverse event, e.g, 4.0
A string value that denotes the group of medications to which the medication belongs.
A string value denoting the name of the medication
A value that denotes the maximum severity grade experienced for the given AE, either using AE CTC grading or AE Intensity grading.
A value that denotes the initial starting severity grade for the given AE, either using AE CTC grading or AE Intensity grading.

AE severity grade values denoted by either CTC or AE Intensity, over time. Where multiple severity grade columns are provided, these should be entered in the order that they occurred, separated by commas, corresponding to the dates provided in the "AE severity change dates (mm/dd/yyyy)" column. Note that the "Multiple AE severity grade changes" aggregation function must be selected for this to work.

Date values that when changes in severity grade over time happened. Where multiple date columns are provided, these should be entered in order, separated by commas, corresponding to the severity values provided in the "AE severity grade changes" column, and the "Multiple AE severity grade changes" aggregation function must be selected.
A string value that denotes the site occupied by the a new lesion

help.pageElement: New Lesion Date of Scan/Clinical Examination
help.helpText: The date on which the new lesion assessment was performed

help.pageElement: Non-Target Lesion Date of Scan/Clinical Examination
help.helpText: The date on which the non-target lesion was assessed
A real number giving the O2 saturation level for the subject
The date on which the subject was originally diagnosed with the disease
A string value denoting whether or not the serious adverse event caused a congenital abnormality or birth defect

help.pageElement: Other Medication or Drug that Caused AE
help.helpText: A string value specifying the name of the medication or drug other than the investigational product that caused the serious adverse event
A string value that summarises the ECG evaluation
A value denoting whether the ECG value captured has clinical significance
A string value denoting whether or not the serious adverse event caused persisting signs of disability or incapacity
A real number vaalue giving the PR interval duration from the ECG measurement
A string that describes the location of the primary tumour
A real number value giving the pulse rate
A real number value giving the QRS duration from the ECG measurement
A real number value giving the QT interval duration from the ECG measurement
A string value that denotes the race of the subject
A string value that describes reasons why the overall ECG evaluation was summarised to be abnormal
A string value denoting the reason why the treatment was administered to the subject

help.pageElement: Reason for Study Drug Dose Change Specification
help.helpText: A string value describing further reason for change being made to the dosing schedule

help.pageElement: Reason RECIST and Investigator Assessments Differ
help.helpText: A string value that describes the reason for which the RECIST response and investigator opinion of response differ.

help.pageElement: Reasonable Possibility AE Caused by Investigational Product (yes/no)
help.helpText: A string value denoting whether the adverse event was probably caused by the investigational product.
A string value that provides the overall response of the subject at the time of assessment
A string value denoting whether or the serious adverse event prolonged or required hospitalisation
A string value that summarises the response of the non-target lesions at the time of assessment
A string value denoting whether or not the subject died as a result of the adverse event(s)
A real number vaalue giving the RR interval duration from the ECG measurement
A string value denoting whether or not the serious adverse event was caused by medication other than the investigational product
A string value specifying whether the serious adverse event was caused as a result of the clinical study procedure
The date on which the sample for the laboratory test was taken
A string value denoting whether the adverse event was of the serious category
A string value that denotes the sex of the subject
A string value denoting the site occupied by the non-target lesion
A string value denoting the site occupied by the assessed target lesion
A string description with further information describing the location of the primary tumour
The date on which the medication regimen began

help.pageElement: Start date/time of the dose schedule
help.helpText: The date on which the dosing schedule began
A string that uniquely identifies the name of the study drug (otherwise known as the "investigational product")
A unique string identifier for the clinical study that will be used to identify the study throughout other data files.
A unique string identifier for the study part identifier that will be used to identify the study part throughout other data files.
A string value specifying the aspect of the study procedure that caused the serious adverse event
A string value giving the name of the subject group
A string value used to name the set of patient groupings that have been mapped in this file, such as "Dose Cohorts". A default value may be applied here.
A unique string identifier for the subject that will be used to identify the subject throughout other data files. The enrolment code is recommended.
A real number value giving the systolic blood pressure
A string value that is the unique identifier for the target lesion that is assessed

help.pageElement: Target Lesion Date of Scan/Clinical Examination
help.helpText: The date on which the target lesion was assessed
A real number value that gives the upper reference range value for the laboratory test result for the subject
A date value for the visit on which the subject was enrolled.
An integer value denoting the number of the visit

The Vital.Module column is required when multiple vitals measurements from the same assessment time point are listed on separate rows. For example, height and weight on one row and O2 saturation on a separate row but all with the same measurement date. As these rows will show different module identifiers, the ACUITY system can use the module column to ensure that the data is pooled, rather than one row overwriting another.
A real number giving the weight of the subject
The identifier for the specimen
The actual date and time when the sample specimen was collected
The category of specimen, relating to the purpose for collection, e.g., "PK, Biofluid"
A text representation of the time point in relation to the study protocol
A numerical representation of the time point, days
A numerical representation of the time point, hours
A numerical representation of the time point, minutes
The date and time of the investigational drug administration to which the specimen collection relates
The name of the analyte, expected to be a drug identifier
The concentration of the analyte in the sample
The unit of concentration for the measurement of the analyte
The lower limit of quantification for the analyte in the sample
The number, or text explanation for the cycle of treatment at the time of sampling
A short description of the treatment the subject is undertaking
A short description of the treatment the subject is undertaking or the dose specified in the protocol
A short description of the treatment schedule the subject is undertaking
A comment that accompanies the concentration result
A text representation of the visit, e.g., Cycle 0 Day 01
A value describing why the target lesion has not been measured
A value denoting the method of assessment of the target lesion
A description of the PK parameter being expressed, e.g., "Cmin"
The date that the subject withdrew from or completed the study
Whether the subject prematurely withdrew rather than completed the study
The main reason why the subject prematurely withdrew
An explanation of the reason for premature withdrawal
The number, expected to be an ethnic population identifier
The text explanation of other ethnic population
The date on which the e-Diary assessment was captured
The time of day at which study drug intake occurred
The name that identifies the type of device or study drug whose intake is being recorded
The time of day that the morning assessment was recorded
The peak expiratory flow recorded at the morning assessment, in L/min
The time of day that the evening assessment was recorded
The peak expiratory flow recorded at the evening assessment, in L/min
The asthma symptom score for the night
The asthma symptom score for the day
Whether one or more awakenings can be attributed to asthma symptoms
Sample ID
Median exon coverage
Disease
Known somatic short variants (percent-reads, coverage)
Likely somatic short variants (percent-reads, coverage)
High-level (CN>8) and focal (CN>5) amplifications of genes amplifications of genes known to be recurrently amplified in cancer (copy number, exons)
Non-focal lower-level (CN<=8) amplifications of genes known to be recurrently amplified in cancer (copy-number, exons)
Homozygous deletions of genes known to be recurrently deleted in cancer (0, exons)
Likely functional rearrangements (e.g., gene fusions) (gene1_gene2_genomic event description_supporting-reads)
Comments
Current state of the AE, e.g. "Recovered/Resolved", Recovering/Resolving", etc.
Flag to specify that this AE defined the upper limit of dosing

help.pageElement: Time Point for Dose Limiting Toxicity
help.helpText: A value that describes the timepoint for dose limiting toxicity, such as a cycle number, visit number or date.
AE driven by immune system imbalance
AE relates to the administration of drug via IV infusion
Flag to specify that this AE required treatment.
AE resulted in the subject having to or choosing to withdraw from the study
Action taken
Investigational drug names
Additional drug names

help.pageElement: Initial action taken for investigational drugs
help.helpText: Initial action taken for investigational drugs

help.pageElement: Initial action taken for additional drugs
help.helpText: Initial action taken for additional drugs

help.pageElement: Action taken due to severity grade changes for investigational drugs
help.helpText: Action taken due to severity grade changes for investigational drugs

help.pageElement: Action taken due to severity grade changes for additional drugs
help.helpText: Action taken due to severity grade changes for additional drugs
Causality for investigational drugs
Causality for additional drugs
A value that describes the substance use category
A value that describes the usage occurrence (never, current, former)
A value that describes the type of the substance
A value that describes alternative type of the substance
A value that describes the substance consumption (Units)
A value that describes frequency interval of the substance usage
The number of the subject visit. Please enter a numeric value only to this field.
The date of the subject visit
The date on which the measurement was made
A value denoting the result of pregnancy test - Serum (positive or negative)
A value denoting the result of pregnancy test - Urine (positive or negative)
A value denoting the result of pregnancy test - Plasma (positive or negative)
A value denoting the result of pregnancy test (positive or negative)
A value describes substance use category
A value describes type of substance
A value describes alternative type of substance
A value describes usage occurrence (never, current, former)
A value describes current substance use specification (habitual or occasional)
A value that describes the substance type usage occurrence
A value that describes the current substance use specification (habitual or occasional)
A date on which the subject ended substance usage
A date on which the subject started substance usage
A value that describes the type of the substance
A value that describes frequency interval of the substance usage
The date on which the subject started substance usage
The date on which the subject ended substance usage
A value describes substance consumption (Units)

Flag to specify that this AE is of particular interest
This field is populated with amino acid change or codon change. If no mutations are detected the text for ‘no mutations detected’ should be captured in this field.
This field is not populated (empty) if no mutations are detected.

‘Tracked mutations‘ can be any subset of mutations (a.a / codon changes) that may or may not be clinically significant. This field must be populated with: • YES - if the mutation is a ‘tracked‘ mutation • NO - if the mutation is not a ‘tracked‘ mutation

VAF - must be reported as a ‘fraction‘ value in the data file. There will be an option to change the units for the y-axis between ‘fraction‘ and ‘percentage‘. The system will perform a calculation if viewing the variant allele frequency as a percentage value on the y-axis.
The clinical study code that the report data relates to.
The date that the study data was uploaded into ACUITY.
The time that the study data was uploaded into ACUITY.
The duration of the ACUITY data upload process.
The Red, Amber or Green status of the upload.
A summary description of the data upload
the ACUITY data set collection that the report log message relates to.
The original file that the data was in prior to upload into ACUITY.
The number of subjects in the source file.
The number of subjects uploaded into ACUITY.
The total number of events, e.g. adverse events, lab measurements, dose events etc., in the ACUITY system after the upload.
The number of found errors.
The Red, Amber or Green status of the upload.
The ACUITY data field that the log entry relates to.
The column in the raw file that the log entry relates to.
The type of error, e.g. a mapping error or a data error, that lead to the Red, Amber or Green status
A longer description of the Error Type
A value of the field that caused the error.
The step in the ETL process that threw the exception
The Java exception class that threw the exception
The detailed massage of the exception
Pick a data table mapping from which you wish values to be excluded. For example, picking ‘Laboratory‘ allows you to exclude certain laboratory test records.

Pick a data field (equivalent to a table column) from the mapping currently selected for which you wish to specify exclusion criteria. For example, picking the ‘Laboratory‘ mapping then ‘Subject identifier‘ data field would allow you to specify a certain subject ID for whom results will not be shown in the laboratory results.
